author: frostst63
title: Friendly and helpful staff
body: CLEAR messages and communication. Friendly staff and helpful. Care given when required, comfortable wait for transport.

author: plefluff
title: Struggling to get an appointment
body:
I believe that my local medical group has consistently failed in providing even the basic care to its patients. Not only is their online "24/7" service down and has been for 2 months at this point, they refuse to schedule any appointments with the GPs regardless of the urgency of the appointment.  
I have been without antidepressants for 4 weeks now, and not out of mismanagement on my behalf, not at all. I've needed to go in for a medicine review and they refuse to prescribe more without seeing me - including antidepressants, contraceptive pill, and Metformin. I am now without two of my medicines and have been in contact with NHS 111 in tears, begging them to help me get an appointment anywhere else just to be prescribed the medicine keeping me from killing myself. Unfortunately, it's outside of their control.  
The GP appears to be absolutely fine with letting their patients go into medicine withdrawal and potentially lose patients because of it. Not to mention their "accessible" website is the exact opposite. Without providing the online 24/7 service, they're restricting the independence of patients who are deaf/hard of hearing or those with chronic social anxieties, preventing them from making phone calls and may not necessarily have anyone around them who will do it for them. I find it a frankly disgusting service. I have begged the receptionist to please just try to fit me in or book me in anywhere, but they simply refused and hung up on me. The last time I managed to get a phone appointment (4 weeks ago and with no lack of trying), I waited on it all day until I had to go to work. At 21:45 I got a phone call from a withheld number whilst I'm driving and miss the phone call. This turns out to be the phone appointment. At damn near 10:00pm. I was never told the phone calls could be that late and simply assumed my appointment had been forgotten, for which I was planning to complain the next day.  
Now, it's the same phone call every week where I call the surgery, get told there are no appointments, and no I can't book a future appointment. I call at 8:30 in the morning and there are no appointments. I am told to call back next week when the schedule is available. I would just like to say that my mental health is at the point of breaking, and I've thought about the worst several times just this morning. This medical practice is disgusting. I wouldn't treat my worst enemy like this.

author: venusyf47
title: Excellent service
body: Inclusion was + continues to be very helpful. As long as I was able to show some effort they + my key work Simon would more than help. Excellent service in helping me to help myself.

author: Una123
title: Life changing support
body:
I became alcohol dependent during covid lockdown. I had been unhappy for man year in my marriage but the lockdown brought added misery and confounded the situation. I began to drink more heavily and eventually it was my only friend, until I discovered inclusion.  
I had tried other avenues to stop drinking but they didn't work for me. I cannot praise Inclusion enough. The help I got from my case workers, the counselling from Dowe, and the teams meetings with Ricky and Emma, were just life changing for me. It helped me to not only stop drinking but to get to the root of the reason why I felt I needed to drink. To change my outlook on life and myself. It helped me to cope with difficult situations and gave me the tools to help myself and have a better life.  
This service and the people providing it are just amazing. I don't know what I would have done without them. I just can't thank them enough. I would recommend this service is more widely advertised and easier for people to fund and access. I am much happier now.  
Thank you all.

author: capellacb57
title: Helpful NHS health check up
body:
I had my NHS health check up.  
It was good, because Kim, the advanced health care assistant, explained things to me well and ensured I understood this check up.  
I also mentioned a few other health issues. She explained what she could help with & what I need to go to the doctor about. It was helpful & kind to know she is willing to help and if I need to talk I can.  
Thank you x.

author: importerme33
title: Helpful appointment
body:
We went in for our appointment about my daughter's tongue tie with Dr Adams. He and his colleagues were all so kind and explained everything really well to us made sure that my baby was happy and comfortable and that me and her dad were happy as well.  
They answered all our questions happily and even gave us some more places we can look should we need more information.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Gebr
title: Excellent service for my mum
body:
Last week my mum (87 years old) attended the continence clinic at Hunter Health Centre in East Kilbride. She was seen by Gillian, who was concerned because my mum's bladder was not emptying properly . Within an hour of arriving home we received a call from the “hospital at home “ team. A senior assessment nurse, Mhairi, arrived and took all the information, stats and bloods. Next came a consultant and finally Gillian came back to fit a catheter and therefore avoiding my mum being admitted to hospital .  
All members of the team treated my mum with the utmost respect and displayed a level of professionalism whilst being sympathetic to her condition . I would like to say a huge thank you to the professionals for such an outstanding job. In times when the NHS is often under fire, I cannot rate them highly enough. Thank you all for an outstanding service

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
